availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John G. Douglass (Cincinnati, Ohio, attorney and commissioner of deeds)

body.p: Cincinnati, Ohio, attorney and commissioner of deeds. New Jersey native. Married to Mary Douglass. Father of Howard Douglass, Ellen Douglass, Clara Douglass, and Walter Douglass. Attorney in Cincinnati in 1860. Commissioner of deeds for the Commonwealth of Kentucky in Cincinnati in 1860 and 1865. Also, Commissioner of deeds for the states of Illinois, Missouri, Michigan, Pennsylvania, Virginia, Wisconsin, Indiana, Tennessee, Mississippi, New Jersey, Arkansas, Iowa, New York, and Alabama in 1860.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati, Ward 14, p. 9; The Cincinnati Enquirer, July 25, 1860, page 4.; Find A Grave, "John G. Douglass (1825-1890)," Memorial #58833114, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=58833114&ref=acom (accessed May 8, 2017).
